block.p: Dara Beth Goldberg and Jonathan Michael Kay are to be married today at the Four Seasons Hotel in Washington. Rabbi Robert Layman is to officiate.
The couple graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, she cum laude and he magna cum laude.
Dara Beth Goldberg and Jonathan Michael Kay are to be married today at the Four Seasons Hotel in Washington. Rabbi Robert Layman is to officiate.
Dara Beth Goldberg and Jonathan Michael Kay are to be married today at the Four Seasons Hotel in Washington. Rabbi Robert Layman is to officiate.
The couple graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, she cum laude and he magna cum laude.
The bride, 41, is the director of external affairs at the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington, overseeing communications and special events.
She is the daughter of Sandra Goldberg and Dr. Stanley Goldberg of Oreland, Pa. Her father is a dentist in Philadelphia, and her mother manages his office.
The bridegroom, also 41, is a senior counsel to the American Red Cross in Washington, preparing and negotiating contracts for services. He received his law degree cum laude from Georgetown.

He is a son of Beverly Kaye of Woodbridge, Conn., and Robert Kaye of Boca Raton, Fla., and is a stepson of Sandra Kaye. His mother runs a gallery for outsider art in her home. She also sells online at ArtBrut.com. His father is the president and a founder of Specwise, a West Palm Beach, Fla., firm specializing in design and estimate software for roofing contractors.
Correction: June 17, 2007, Sunday A report last Sunday, about the marriage of Dara Beth Goldberg, misspelled the bridegroom's surname. He is Jonathan Michael Kaye, not Kay.
A report last Sunday, about the marriage of Dara Beth Goldberg, misspelled the bridegroom's surname. He is Jonathan Michael Kaye, not Kay.
